alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 1:02PM MST until December 02 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM MST FOR CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO...WALLACE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL KANSAS AND SHERMAN COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS... At 101 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 8 miles south of Bird City to near Goodland to 16 miles south of Kanorado to 9 miles northeast of Boyero, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 65 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 35. Highway 385 between mile markers 136 and 169. This dust channel will be near... Goodland around 105 PM MST. Weskan around 130 PM MST. Sharon Springs around 135 PM MST. Kit Carson around 140 PM MST. Other locations impacted by this dust channel include Edson, Firstview, Wild Horse, Arapahoe and Aroya. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
